title: Altoids Fonts
content:
Looking for an ID on the Altoids subhead font.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [altoids.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005204000/http:/typophile.com/files/altoids.jpg) | 36.31 KB |
author: timlahan

comments.content:
That's actually from a photograph, with maxed out levels. For a better example:

[http://www.britsuperstore.com/acatalog/Altoids\_Tin\_50g.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005204000/http:/www.britsuperstore.com/acatalog/Altoids_Tin_50g.jpg "http://www.britsuperstore.com/acatalog/Altoids\_Tin\_50g.jpg")

I still think it might be hand-drawn or at least custom. I have an Altoids tin here as well. You can find some like it if you do a search at myfonts for slabserif but I didn't find anything all that close.

The extended styles of Dispatch might be an option:

[http://fontbureau.com/fonts/slab/Dispatch](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005204000/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/slab/Dispatch "http://fontbureau.com/fonts/slab/Dispatch")
I believe we've visited the Altoids fonts here before and they were determined to be custom. The original label was hand drawn and then a proprietary font was made from those forms.
[This](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005204000/http:/typophile.com/node/5831) is the thread Stephen is talking about.
